Entries.default: "Apretta, what do you want?" Tiela sniffs and eases back.
"That's close enough." The young girl narrows her eyes and reaches for a dagger tucked into her back pocket.
"Whoa there - no need for that."
[Draw your weapon.] "If that's how you want it, kid."
"What can I do for you?"
"Belfetto. Smarter than you look." Her hands drop to her sides.
"Can't be too careful. Queen's Berth has an edge to her."
"What's a kid like you doing on the streets of Neketaka?"
"Farewell."
She backs away a step, her eyes widening to the size of bronze ≈ças.
[Say nothing.]
"Complanca, I yield!" She holds out her palms.
Her cheeks are sallow and she licks the edges of her dried lips. Even if she had eaten this week, you doubt she'd be in fighting shape.
"You're... just gonna stand there?" She slowly drops her hands to her sides and breathes a sigh of relief.
"Nasenale. I've never had a roof over my head longer than an evening." She cocks an eyebrow at you.
"You know anything about the local pirates hassling Zamar?"
"Ac, if they're the same ones who robbed Radora blind." She drags her threadbare sleeve across her nose.
"The boss and his wolf sleep their fun off by day."
"But by night he and his bazzo friends keep to the alley, giving out bruises for coin." She gestures off in the opposite direction.
"I guess cutting me loose was cheaper on my parents than passage back to the Republics."
"Let's not do anything hasty, ac?"
[Give her an egg.] "You look like you could use this."
"Agracima..." She takes the egg in both hands and gently nestles it into a pouch.
"That'll staunch my pains for an evening, at least."
"Or a few bites of bitter squash."
